Description: The destruction of Pharaoh's host in the Red Sea; the pharaoh on horseback and his troups drowning in the foreground, on the shore Moses and the Israelites looking on, landscape in the background and a cloud with a pillar of fire in the sky; see fol. Hv of Johann Geiler von Kaisersberg, 'Das Buch Granatapfel...', Strasbourg: Johann Knoblouch, 1511. Woodcut
Curator's comments: This is from a reprint of Geiler's sermons printed by Johann Ottmar in Augsburg 1510 with illustrations by Hans Burgkmair the Elder (Hollstein 276-281), on which Baldung's woodcuts are based. According to ms notes by Dodgson found with this print, this impression is not from the Knoblouch 1511 edition (which has no HB monogram on the flag, and different text on the verso) but possibly a Grüninger edition. BM also has St Elizabeth from the same series, see 1895,0122.238. Lit: Matthias Mende, 'Hans Baldung Grien. Das graphische Werk', Unterschneidheim 1978, no.406.
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (216)
Associated names: Illustration to: Johann Geiler von Kaysersberg
